    • countUiOrderAndDescription

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) UDFMetadataBase.UiOrderDescriptionCount countUiOrderAndDescription(int[] users, int uiOrder, String description)
      Counts existing UDF security metadata entries with matching UI order and description values for validation. This method executes a native SQL query to efficiently check uniqueness constraints by counting how many UDF security metadata entries already exist with the specified UI order or description within the given user scope.
      The query performs two separate count operations:
      1. Counts entries with the same UI order value for the specified users
      2. Counts entries with the same description for the specified users
      This information is used to enforce uniqueness constraints before creating or updating UDF security metadata entries, ensuring that UI order values remain unique for proper field arrangement and descriptions remain unique within the user's scope.
      Parameters:
      users - array of user IDs to check within (typically includes the current user and system user ID 0)
      uiOrder - the UI order value to check for existing usage
      description - the description text to check for existing usage
      Returns:
      a UiOrderDescriptionCount object containing the count of existing entries with matching UI order and description values

    • getAllByIdUserInOrderByUiOrderExcludeDisabled

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) List<UDFMetadataSecurity> getAllByIdUserInOrderByUiOrderExcludeDisabled(int idUser)
      Retrieves all UDF security metadata entries accessible to a user, excluding disabled fields and ordered by UI sequence. This method executes a native SQL query that combines security-specific UDF metadata with base UDF metadata, applying multiple filtering criteria to return only relevant and enabled fields.
      The query applies the following filters:
      1. Includes entries for the specified user and system-wide entries (user ID 0)
      2. Excludes fields that have been explicitly disabled by the user via UDFSpecialTypeDisableUser
      3. Filters to user-defined fields only (UI order invalid input: '<' 100, excluding system fields)
      4. Orders results by UI order for consistent form field arrangement
      The returned metadata includes both security-specific properties (category types, investment instruments) and general UDF properties (description, data type, field size, etc.) needed for dynamic form generation.
      Parameters:
      idUser - the ID of the user for whom to retrieve accessible UDF security metadata entries
      Returns:
      a list of UDFMetadataSecurity objects containing complete metadata for enabled user-defined security fields, ordered by UI order for proper form field sequence
